research.title: The Impact of the 2018 Trade War on U.S. Prices and Welfare
research.description: Amiti, Redding & Weinstein (NBER WP 25672, 2019) find near‑complete tariff pass‑through to consumer prices, reducing U.S. real income by about $1.4 billion per month by year‑end 2018.

research.title: The Return to Protectionism
research.description: Fajgelbaum, Goldberg, Kennedy & Khandelwal (QJE 2020; NBER WP 25638) estimate consumer and producer losses of $51 billion—0.27 % of U.S. GDP—from 2018 import and retaliatory tariffs.

research.title: Rising Import Tariffs, Falling Export Growth
research.description: Handley, Kamal & Monarch (AEJ: Applied Economics 2023) show that tariff increases along supply‑chain links cut U.S. export growth through higher input costs and reduced competitiveness.
